data.quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
data.author: Linus Torvalds

data.quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
data.author: Harold Abelson

data.quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live
data.author: John Woods

data.quote: How you look at it is pretty much how you'll see it
data.author: Rasheed Ogunlaru

data.quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
data.author: John Johnson

data.quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
data.author: Martin Fowler

data.quote: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
data.author: Coco Chanel

data.quote: Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.
data.author: Chris Heilman

data.quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
data.author: Cory House

data.quote: Fix the cause, not the symptom.
data.author: Steve Maguire

data.quote: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
data.author: Kent Beck

data.quote: When to use iterative development? You should use iterative development only on projects that you want to succeed.
data.author: Martin Fowler

data.quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
data.author: Austin Freeman

data.quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
data.author: Ralph Johnson

data.quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
data.author: Kent Beck

data.quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
data.author: Patrick Mckenzie

data.quote: No one in the brief history of computing has ever written a piece of perfect software. It's unlikely that you'll be the first.
data.author: Andy Hunt

data.quote: One of the best programming skills you can have is knowing when to walk away for awhile.
data.author: Oscar Godson

data.quote: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
data.author: Louis Srygley

data.quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
data.author: Kent Beck

data.quote: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
data.author: Edsger Dijkstra

data.quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
data.author: Bill Gates

data.quote: They don’t make bugs like Bunny anymore.
data.author: Olav Mjelde

data.quote: Everyday life is like programming, I guess. If you love something you can put beauty into it.
data.author: Donald Knuth

data.quote: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
data.author: Seymour Cray

data.quote: Deleted code is debugged code.
data.author: Jeff Sickel

data.quote: Linux is only free if your time has no value.
data.author: Jamie Zawinski

data.quote: Writing code has a place in the human hierarchy worth somewhere above grave robbing and beneath managing.
data.author: Gerald Weinberg

data.quote: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however they should not be combined.
data.author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

data.quote: When someone says, “I want a programming language in which I need only say what I want done,” give him a lollipop.
data.author: Alan Perlis

data.quote: Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.
data.author: Donald Knuth

data.quote: Good design adds value faster than it adds cost.
data.author: Thomas C. Gale

data.quote: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1000 lines of code.
data.author: Ken Thompson
